title: Driver let children as young as 11 drive school bus
text:
Joandrea McAtee, 27, was sentenced to two years of probation after she pleaded guilty. (Picture: ABC)

A driver who allowed children as young as 11 years old to drive a school bus has been sentenced to probation.

Joandrea McAtee, 28, was sentenced Monday to two years of probation for allowing the youngsters behind the wheel after she pleaded guilty to felony neglect of a dependent last month.

Police say McAtee let three students, aged 11, 13 and 17 drive the school bus down a rural road near Valparaiso, Indiana in September 2018.

McAtee’s guilty plea came after she made an agreement with prosecutors that will allow her to petition to reduce the felony charge to a misdemeanor if she completes probation.

Video taken of the incident shows McAtee instructing the students on how to operate the school bus. The footage was later shared to social media.

No one was hurt during the incident, but parents were outraged after seeing the footage and contacted the school district. McAtee was later fired by the Porter Township School Administration.

She was arrested when she arrived at the Porter Township Bus Barn to pick up her final paycheck.

Dave Reynolds, the Porter County Sheriff said at the time: ‘The students and parents that immediately came forward with this information should be commended for doing exactly what we teach, which is “see something, say something.”‘
